pages.text:
Our mission
Art in the Park is an annual event dedicated to fine art, craftsmanship, and community that creates a unique opportunity and tradition for artists, collectors, and patrons of the arts.
Celebrating artistry
since 1984
Art in the Park is an annual event dedicated to fine art, craftsmanship, and community that creates a unique opportunity and tradition for artists, collectors, and patrons of the arts. Artists and artisans showcase a wide variety of works and mediums inside of Tom Varn Park– a natural setting surrounded by beautiful oak trees in Brooksville, Florida. This will be our 39th annual show bringing in a diverse crowd of 6,000 attendees from Hernando County and our neighboring communities for a celebration of artistry in a relaxed, welcoming atmosphere.
Our Goals
Produce a successful show that showcases regional and national artists and their artwork
Provide support to artists with contests, awards, opportunities that provide unique experiences, and a growing network of likeminded artists and supporters
Celebrate diversity by supporting artists in varying cultures as well as by serving our underserved communities, working to reach creative people from all walks of life
Communicate the power and value of art by working with organizations and members throughout our community
Continue to carry out the mission of the
Hernando County Fine Arts Council
which is to encourage, promote, and support all of the creative arts in Hernando County with positive leadership, community collaboration, and goals that continue to grow with our network
About the Arts Council
The
Hernando County Fine Arts Council
grew organically from a group of artists in Hernando and surrounding counties when they formed the Tri-County Professional Art League in 1982. Just two years later, the League needed a way to display their work and established the very first Art in the Park, an annual tradition that continues today. It was a logical next step when a forward-thinking Board of County Commissioners (BOCC) created the
Hernando County Fine Arts Council
in 1987 under the authority of the Florida Statutes.
Now the Arts Council has a working board with 15 active members that serve 4-year terms. We work year-round to put on the largest art show in Hernando County and use the funds raised to offer two grant programs to our community and encourage, promote, and support the arts in Hernando County with resources and programs for all.
Learn more
More about the
Hernando County Fine Arts Council
Our mission is to
encourage, promote, and support
all the creative arts in Hernando County and to provide a means to showcase the arts.
Through advocacy, engagement, education, and art-inspired programs and events, we work to fulfill this mission. We are dedicated to providing accessible opportunities that invite art into the lives of Hernando County residents and visitors.

Art in the Park is proudly presented by the
Hernando County Fine Arts Council
Second Weekend in March – Tom Varn Park – 306 Darby Lane Brooksville, Florida 34601

If you have any questions or comments, please don’t hesitate to reach out using the contact form. For questions or comments regarding exhibiting, please email info@hernandoarts.org. For questions or comments regarding sponsorships, please email artinthepark@hernandoarts.org.
